page.title: 17NOTABLE EVENTS - WEST STROUD
page.content: The main notable event affecting community life in our area in 1985 is the huge row that has occurred over the re-organisation of secondary education. Stroud has always had two Grammar Schools, Marling School for boys and Stroud High School for girls. There are also four other secondary schools. Selection for these schools is unfairly distributed causing great disappointment to many families. This year, the Education Secretary announced the planned closure of the two Grammar Schools, so that all secondary schools in the area will be eleven to sixteen comprehensive schools with a sixth form college on the site of the 'Grammar' schools. At the present time this issue is still unresolved and much opposition to the plan still exists.
